title: Sunrise Tai Chi
description:
Date: May 25, 2022

Fort Tryon Park has long been a place of healing and health, especially during the stress of the pandemic. Take in the majestic views of the Hudson River while boosting your mental and physical health at weekly classes with instructor Robert Martinez.

Tai chi is a system of movements and positions believed to have developed in 12th Century China. Tai chi techniques aim to address the body and mind as interconnected systems. Benefits include improved balance, pain management, improved brain function and sleep quality, and communal activity.

These classes are suitable for all levels. Wear comfortable clothing and bring water.

Please check the Fort Tryon Park Trust’s Facebook Page for weather/air advisory cancellations.

Please arrive on time.

Start time: 6:30 am

End time: 7:30 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

Location: Linden Terrace (in Fort Tryon Park)

title: Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy
description:
Date: May 25, 2022

See Frederick Law Olmsted’s lasting influence on park innovation in New York City with “Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy,” on view at the Arsenal Gallery in Central Park. The commemorative exhibition looks at recent NYC Parks projects that incorporate various Olmsted design principles, including site responsiveness, respect for nature, and the orchestration of movement. With renderings, site plans, and photos, the show highlights 10 park renovations throughout the city:

  • Bronx: Hugh Grant Circle/Virginia Park and Concrete Plant Park
  • Brooklyn: Lincoln Terrace Playground and Sunset Park Playground
  • Manhattan: Monsignor Kett Playground and Central Park’s Harlem Meer Center (formerly Lasker Rink and Pool)
  • Queens: Elmhurst Park and Bayswater Park
  • Staten Island: Faber Park and Richmond Terrace

April 26, 2022 marks the 200th anniversary of the birth of Frederick Law Olmsted (1822-1903), a pioneer landscape architect famous for his work co-designing Central Park, Prospect Park, and other well-known urban green spaces. From the democratization of public parks to the contouring of landscape and terrain to create a variety of visual experience, Olmsted was a seminal force in the design of our parks and how they are used.

Image: Concrete Plant Park, Bronx, 2009, NYC Parks / Jim Mituzas

Please note: Mask-wearing is required to enter the Arsenal Gallery, and guests are required to sign in. Groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register. The gallery is closed on federal holidays.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: The Arsenal

title: Little Red's Hood at Jackie Robinson Park
description:
Date: May 25, 2022

Little Red’s Hood is a fresh retelling of the classic ‘Little Red Riding Hood’ tale updated with a modern sensibility that appeals to kids. In this story, Little Red is a smart, young city dweller who is obsessed with her smartphone. Wulfric, a misunderstood wolf with a sweet tooth, crosses paths with Little Red on her travels to deliver her Grandma cupcakes and the trouble begins. This story offers a comical lesson on the importance to disconnect from our digital lives and enjoy real life moment with friends and family.

title: Virtual Special Express Writers
description:
Date: May 25, 2022

Illuminating the voices of adults living with developmental challenges.

Participants are guided through writing for self-expression via virtual class. Participants encourage and support each other. Patrons may dictate or write their stories. The facilitator focuses on the participants' strengths to assure their success. Participants submit stories to compile for a production.

Sessions are fluid to allow for individual differences and participants select who or what they wish to write to.

Participants should have an interest in writing stories and memoirs.

To register, please call (718) 365-5516 or email Lucy.Aponte@parksnyc.gov.

title: KIM programming at DeMatti playground
description:
Date: May 25, 2022

The Kids in Motion program engages children in active, outdoor play. An NYC Parks staff member leads four to seven hours of free activities in NYC’s playgrounds, including organized sports, games, fitness demos, board games, water games, and more!

Kids in Motion is a free, drop-in program without registration. Children can head to the playground during the listed hours of operation to participate. Occasionally a Kids in Motion program may be cancelled due to harsh weather or other conditions.

Please note: We recommend that guardians accompany children participating in this program. Kids in Motion is not a child care program and NYC Parks is not responsible for the well-being of attendees.

title: Cocina Movil
description:
Date: May 25, 2022

Dyckman Farmhouse Museum Educator Fabiola Cáceres and Miledis Santana, an Inwood community member who is originally from the Dominican Republic, meet in the DFM kitchen to prepare a Morro de Guandules, an essential cultural recipe.

Join them as they cook and contemplate the history of a dish born in the Caribbean and what is behind a recipe that tells the stories of the “guandul”; Miledis’ journey as an immigrant in the US, and how she finds comfort in her hometown’s food.

This is a virtual event held in Spanish.

COCINA MOVIL
La educadora del Museo Dyckman Farmhouse, Fabiola Cáceres, y Miledis Santana, una miembro de la comunidad Dominicana en Inwood, se reúnen en la cocina del museo para preparar un Moro de Guandules, una receta de esencial importancia cultural. Únase a la pareja mientras cocinan y contemplan la historia de un platillo que nació en el Caribe, y lo que hay detrás de esta receta que cuenta las historias del guandul; el viaje de Miledis como inmigrante a los Estados Unidos, y como ella se nutre espiritualmente en la comida de su. tie

Start time: 2:00 pm

End time: 3:00 pm

Contact phone:

title: Argentine Tango
description:
Date: May 25, 2022

Argentine Tango is a partner dance that developed over the last century in Argentina's capital city, Buenos Aires. It is very different from the Tango in International and American ballroom dancing. Argentine Tango is an interpretive, improvisational social dance that allows the dancers to develop a deep connection between themselves, the music, and the environment in which they are dancing.

About The Harlem Swing Dance Society (THSDS):
The Harlem Swing Dance Society is a premier organization dedicated to culturally sharing the history is Lindy Hop, Swing dance, and the historic Savoy Ballroom in its Harlem home. Check their calendar and classes here: Theharlemswingdance.org

title: Artist Talk and Q&A with Dario Mohr
description:
Date: May 25, 2022

Meet the Artist! Please join us for a virtual artist talk with Dario Mohr as he provides insight into his artistic vision and works, followed by a Q & A session with the audience.

"Blood is Thicker than the Water that Separated U.S." is an exhibition of LED light works inspired by Lewis Latimer's technological triumphs, the Latimer family's history of forced migration, presented with Mohr's personal history. Mohr seeks to engage audiences in conversation around immigration, reconnection to ancestral lineage, and reclamation in one's journey of interwoven identities.

Dario Mohr is a New York City-based interdisciplinary artist who creates interactive sanctuary experiences. Born in 1988, Mohr received a BFA from Buffalo State College, and an MFA from The City College of New York. In addition to work created in painting, sculpture, or made digitally, he often includes assembled objects to build immersive "sacred spaces". These often exist in unexpected places, using mundane objects. Because objects are endowed with the significance that the viewer blesses them with, his work can provide a lot of space for divergent perspectives and interpretations. The recycling of old work is also fundamental to Mohr's practice. Sometimes a previously used item provides the perfect juxtaposition to enhance or add depth to new explorations. In addition to his individual art practice, he is also the Founder and Director of AnkhLave Arts Alliance, Inc. which is a non-profit for the recognition and representation of BIPOC artists in contemporary art.

The artist talk will take place live on Zoom. Register via Eventbrite to receive Zoom access information.

Start time: 6:00 pm

End time: 7:00 pm

title: Sunset Yoga
description:
Date: May 25, 2022

Enjoy free yoga classes while overlooking the beautiful Hudson River and basking in the glow of the setting sun!

Bring a towel or a yoga mat and water. Use your masks and socially distance as appropriate.

Abby’s Lawn is slightly sloped and there are some uneven spots. Rain or wet ground cancels the class. For cancelations, check the Fort Tryon Park Facebook Page.

Please note: There is no advance registration. Arrive early as capacity is limited and attendance is on a first-come, first-served basis. Every attendee must sign an NYC Parks/Fort Tryon Park Trust waiver on-site at each session. You must sign in each week. Sign the waiver with our volunteer starting 6:30 p.m.

About the Instructor

Certified instructor, Stacey Linden, has been teaching yoga for twenty years and it has been integral in her life — physically, mentally, and spiritually. We are happy to have her share its many facets with our park community. Stacey teaches at all levels and believes yoga should be practiced, not “perfected.” Every time we step onto our mats, we can be just a little surprised by where our bodies, minds, and breath are at that moment.

Sunset Yoga is a program presented by the Fort Tryon Park Trust.

Start time: 6:45 pm

End time: 8:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

Location: Abby's Lawn (in Fort Tryon Park)

title: Movies Under the Stars: Belfast
description:
Date: May 25, 2022

Grab a blanket and come enjoy a movie in a neighborhood park or playground! This spring, NYC Parks and The Mayor’s Office of Media and Entertainment will host family-friendly movie showings across the five boroughs.

“It is 1969 and 9-year-old Buddy finds his peaceful life disturbed as a national conflict is starting to brew in Northern Ireland: unionists and loyalists—mostly Protestants—want the country to remain within the United Kingdom, while nationalists and republicans—mostly Catholics—are campaigning for the country to join a united Ireland. As the tension between these two opposing forces escalates, he and his family must decide whether to stay, or move somewhere safe.”

Movies begin at dusk. This event is FREE and open to the public. Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited. In the event of heavy rain or extreme weather, the screening may be canceled. The decision to cancel the event will be made prior to the screening and will be prominently posted on our website.

For more information visit nyc.gov/parks or call 311. Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Rated PG-13
The following movie has been rated PG-13. Some material may be inappropriate for young children. Parents may wish to consider whether it should be viewed by those under 13.

Start time: 8:00 pm

End time: 10:00 pm

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: May 26, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 7:30 am

End time: 8:30 am

Contact phone: 2127951388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)

title: Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy
description:
Date: May 26, 2022

See Frederick Law Olmsted’s lasting influence on park innovation in New York City with “Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy,” on view at the Arsenal Gallery in Central Park. The commemorative exhibition looks at recent NYC Parks projects that incorporate various Olmsted design principles, including site responsiveness, respect for nature, and the orchestration of movement. With renderings, site plans, and photos, the show highlights 10 park renovations throughout the city:

  • Bronx: Hugh Grant Circle/Virginia Park and Concrete Plant Park
  • Brooklyn: Lincoln Terrace Playground and Sunset Park Playground
  • Manhattan: Monsignor Kett Playground and Central Park’s Harlem Meer Center (formerly Lasker Rink and Pool)
  • Queens: Elmhurst Park and Bayswater Park
  • Staten Island: Faber Park and Richmond Terrace

April 26, 2022 marks the 200th anniversary of the birth of Frederick Law Olmsted (1822-1903), a pioneer landscape architect famous for his work co-designing Central Park, Prospect Park, and other well-known urban green spaces. From the democratization of public parks to the contouring of landscape and terrain to create a variety of visual experience, Olmsted was a seminal force in the design of our parks and how they are used.

Image: Concrete Plant Park, Bronx, 2009, NYC Parks / Jim Mituzas

Please note: Mask-wearing is required to enter the Arsenal Gallery, and guests are required to sign in. Groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register. The gallery is closed on federal holidays.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: The Arsenal

title: Weekday Nature Exploration
description:
Date: May 26, 2022

Join Prospect Park Alliance for nature education programs on Thursdays and Fridays at the Prospect Park Audubon Center, the first urban Audubon Center in the nation.

Discovery Pack, 12–3 pm: Come explore nature on your own with our Discovery Packs, a backpack filled with nature activities and exploration tools, perfect for families and kids to interact with the park in a whole new way!
Animal Encounter, 2–3 pm: Join Alliance Naturalists in learning more about the animals in the Audubon Center’s collection. This program starts promptly at 2 pm.
Family Bird Walk, 3–4 pm: Prospect Park is a stopping point for hundreds of bird species each year! Join us as we search for these amazing creatures and other nature around the park. Binoculars and bird guides are provided. This program departs from the Audubon Center promptly at 3 pm.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

In this story, Little Red is a smart, young city dweller who is obsessed with her smartphone. Wulfric, a misunderstood wolf with a sweet tooth, crosses paths with Little Red on her travels to deliver her Grandma cupcakes and the trouble begins. This story offers a comical lesson on the importance to disconnect from our digital lives and enjoy real life moment with friends and family.

title: Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

See Frederick Law Olmsted’s lasting influence on park innovation in New York City with “Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy,” on view at the Arsenal Gallery in Central Park. The commemorative exhibition looks at recent NYC Parks projects that incorporate various Olmsted design principles, including site responsiveness, respect for nature, and the orchestration of movement. With renderings, site plans, and photos, the show highlights 10 park renovations throughout the city:

  • Bronx: Hugh Grant Circle/Virginia Park and Concrete Plant Park
  • Brooklyn: Lincoln Terrace Playground and Sunset Park Playground
  • Manhattan: Monsignor Kett Playground and Central Park’s Harlem Meer Center (formerly Lasker Rink and Pool)
  • Queens: Elmhurst Park and Bayswater Park
  • Staten Island: Faber Park and Richmond Terrace

April 26, 2022 marks the 200th anniversary of the birth of Frederick Law Olmsted (1822-1903), a pioneer landscape architect famous for his work co-designing Central Park, Prospect Park, and other well-known urban green spaces. From the democratization of public parks to the contouring of landscape and terrain to create a variety of visual experience, Olmsted was a seminal force in the design of our parks and how they are used.

Image: Concrete Plant Park, Bronx, 2009, NYC Parks / Jim Mituzas

Please note: Mask-wearing is required to enter the Arsenal Gallery, and guests are required to sign in. Groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register. The gallery is closed on federal holidays.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: The Arsenal

title: Abs & Cores
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

Your body hears everything, what are your abs saying to you? Class will start with the Pilates ring also known as the magic circle for an upper and lower ab burning workout. The harder you press the ring, the more you engage your muscles. Scissor kicks, leg lifts, v-ups, bicycle crunches, jack knifes and more is the perfect blend of exercises to work the abs and obliques with focus on breathing too. You will see and feel a huge change in your core development after your commitment to this intense class.

title: KIM programming at DeMatti playground
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

The Kids in Motion program engages children in active, outdoor play. An NYC Parks staff member leads four to seven hours of free activities in NYC’s playgrounds, including organized sports, games, fitness demos, board games, water games, and more!

Kids in Motion is a free, drop-in program without registration. Children can head to the playground during the listed hours of operation to participate. Occasionally a Kids in Motion program may be cancelled due to harsh weather or other conditions.

Please note: We recommend that guardians accompany children participating in this program. Kids in Motion is not a child care program and NYC Parks is not responsible for the well-being of attendees.

Meet the challenge of swimming 25 miles or more over the summer months and earn a 25-miler t-shirt or test yourself by entering a top 3 swimmer competition at your pool and win a first, second or third place distance trophy. title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 11:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 879-0794

title: A Life Lived - Oral Story Telling for Adults: Virtual and Live
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

Many older adults have lived a life they often do not share. In this class, participants will tell their stories to record for themselves or leave behind as a legacy for their families. They are the keepers of the family stories and have survived much like warriors. we will go through the developmental years from childhood into adulthood.

Childhood: What were you like as a child? (curious, rambunctious, creative, talkative, quiet, etc?) What caught your attention? What did you get into trouble for? (curiosity, creativity, being the oldest/youngest/middle child), Who were your role models? What did you do that was unusual? Did your childhood personality predict who you would be as an adult?

Stories may be submitted for publication. Writers and storytellers retain rights to their stories.

Please note: This class is open to adults via Zoom if unable to attend in person. To register for the Zoom link, please email Lucy.Aponte@parks.nyc.gov. In-person participation will take place at St. Mary's Recreation Center at 450 St. Ann's Avenue, Bron NY 10455.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 365-5516

title: Weekday Nature Exploration
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

Join Prospect Park Alliance for nature education programs on Thursdays and Fridays at the Prospect Park Audubon Center, the first urban Audubon Center in the nation.

Discovery Pack, 12–3 pm: Come explore nature on your own with our Discovery Packs, a backpack filled with nature activities and exploration tools, perfect for families and kids to interact with the park in a whole new way!
Animal Encounter, 2–3 pm: Join Alliance Naturalists in learning more about the animals in the Audubon Center’s collection. This program starts promptly at 2 pm.
Family Bird Walk, 3–4 pm: Prospect Park is a stopping point for hundreds of bird species each year! Join us as we search for these amazing creatures and other nature around the park. Binoculars and bird guides are provided. This program departs from the Audubon Center promptly at 3 pm.

Start time: 12:00 pm

title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

title: CANCELLED: Baby & Me Yoga in The Battery Labyrinth
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

Please note: this event has been cancelled.

The Battery Conservancy and HRP Mamas invite parents to practice yoga with your baby in a relaxed, supportive environment, while learning to regain the strength in your core muscles after giving birth. Babies are placed on a yoga blanket in front of mom’s mat (or they can be kept in their stroller if they’re sleeping!).

This flowing yoga practice focuses on strengthening Pelvic floor and abdominal muscles (you will be checked for Diastasis Recti.) Students are welcome to take a break to feed or change their baby if needed. Baby Yoga, massage and songs are included.

Babies are 4-6 weeks until crawling.

Bring a yoga mat for you and a blanket or beach towel to place your baby on in front of your mat.

Learn more about programs, events, and how you can get involved at www.hrpmamas.com and www.thebattery.org.

Start time: 1:30 pm

End time: 3:30 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Labyrinth Farm (in The Battery)

title: CANCELLED: Prenatal Yoga in The Battery Labyrinth
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

Please note: this event has been cancelled.

The Battery Conservancy in collaboration with HRP Mamas invite you to Prenatal Yoga Friday afternoons in the Labyrinth with Mary Barnes

A flowing yoga class that helps you gain strength and flexibility through all trimesters of pregnancy, while teaching you how to use yoga to aid you during childbirth. Includes pelvic floor strengthening and awareness.

Learn how to safely strengthen your abdominals to maintain postural integrity during pregnancy and recover your abs quickly after giving birth.

Bring a yoga mat.

Learn more about programs, events, and how you can get involved at www.hrpmamas.com and www.thebattery.org.

Start time: 3:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Labyrinth Farm (in The Battery)

title: Concert: Olmsted 200: Lungs of the City: Olmsted's Parks in Music
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

Join Ft Tryon Trust and the American Wild Ensemble for Lungs of the City: Olmsted’s Parks in Music is a program of new chamber music commemorating the 2022 bicentennial of the birth of Frederick Law Olmsted. In this concert, American Wild Ensemble, a septet of winds, strings, and percussion, will perform eight new works inspired by Olmsted-designed parks including Brooklyn’s Prospect Park and Manhattan’s Fort Tryon Park. The program includes newly commissioned works by composers Oliver Caplan, Nell Shaw Cohen, Michael-Thomas Foumai, Libby Meyer, Ayumi Okada, Justin Ralls, Christina Rusnak, and Ryan Suleiman. Lungs of the City: Olmsted’s Parks in Musicis a cross-regional concert series of world premieres co-curated and co-commissioned by American Wild Ensemble, Juventas New Music Ensemble, Landscape Music, and Michigan Technological University Department of Visual and Performing Arts.

Seating won't be provided, please bring your own chairs and blankets.

Start time: 6:30 pm

End time: 8:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Dongan Lawn (in Fort Tryon Park)

title: Movie Under the Stars: Dog
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

Grab a blanket and come enjoy a movie in a neighborhood park or playground! This summer, NYC Parks and The Mayor’s Office of Media and Entertainment will host family-friendly movie showings across the five boroughs.

In this road-trip, two hard-charging former Army Rangers paired against their will — Briggs and a Belgian Malinois named Lulu — race down the Pacific Coast in hopes of making it to a fellow soldier’s funeral on time.

Movies begin at dusk. This event is FREE and open to the public. Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited. In the event of heavy rain or extreme weather, the screening may be canceled. The decision to cancel the event will be made prior to the screening and will be prominently posted on our website.

For more information visit nyc.gov/parks or call 311. Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 8:00 pm

End time: 10:00 pm

Contact phone:

title: Movies Under the Stars:  Raya and the Last Dragon
description:
Date: May 27, 2022

Grab a blanket and come enjoy a movie in a neighborhood park or playground! This spring, NYC Parks and The Mayor’s Office of Media and Entertainment will host family-friendly movie showings across the five boroughs.

"Kumandra is a place where humans and dragons peacefully coexist. When sinister monsters called the Druun threaten the community, however, the dragons readily make a sacrifice to save the human race. Hundreds of years later, the same threat returns. It is up to Raya, a lone warrior, to stop them once and for all. She tracks down the last dragon alive. But as she embarks on her journey, she realizes that it will take more than a dragon and its magic to save her world."

Movies begin at dusk. This event is FREE and open to the public. Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited. In the event of heavy rain or extreme weather, the screening may be canceled. The decision to cancel the event will be made prior to the screening and will be prominently posted on our website.

For more information visit nyc.gov/parks or call 311. Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

This movie is sponsored by Council Member Keith Powers.

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 8:30 am

End time: 9:30 am

Contact phone: 2127951388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
categories: Nature | Fitness | Seniors | Hiking | Exercise Classes | Strength Training/Weightlifting | Walking

title: Weekend Nature Exploration
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

Join the Prospect Park Alliance for nature education programs on Saturdays and Sundays at the Prospect Park Audubon Center, the first urban Audubon Center in the nation.

Discovery Pack, 10 am–12 pm: Come explore nature on your own with our Discovery Packs, a backpack filled with nature activities and exploration tools, perfect for families and kids to interact with the park in a whole new way!
Animal Encounter, 11 am–12 pm: Join Alliance Naturalists in learning more about the animals in the Audubon Center’s collection. This program starts promptly at 11 am.
Nature’s Helpers, 12–1 pm: Help do your part to keep Prospect Park healthy by cleaning up the lakeshore. In this citizen science activity Audubon staff will guide groups to remove litter and record the findings. Fun for all ages and all materials are provided. This program departs from the Audubon Center promptly at 12 pm.

title: HEART OF A HOUSE: The Olmsted-Beil House
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

Presented by Friends of Olmsted-Beil House, this exhibit will share the story of the c1685 Olmsted-Beil House and those who owned the home, including Dominie Petrus Tesschenmaker (1685-1696), Frederick Law Olmsted (1848-1855), Carlton and Louise Beil (1955-2006), and many other prominent and noteworthy individuals and families. The exhibit includes photographic images, paintings, wall text, video, books, artifacts, sculptures, and collections.

The Olmsted-Beil House on Staten Island is a New York City Landmark listed on the New York State and National Registers of Historic Places.

Opening reception: Sunday, May 29, 2022 from 1:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m.

Closed Sundays and holidays.

title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

title: Play + Go and Green + Grow in Prospect Park
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

Families and children can enjoy nature and explore the park on their own schedule with Play + Go and Green + Grow Pop-Up Programs! Join Prospect Park Alliance at locations around the park and surrounding neighborhoods as we bring our favorite activities from the Prospect Park Audubon Center and Lefferts Historic House on the road in easy-to-borrow play and go kits.

Come to the Pop-Up and hand pick your own Play + Go Kit with up to five (5) items and mix and match some historic games and toys or nature games and activities. Participate in our new Green + Grow activities by lending a hand in a stewardship activity such as raking, litter patrol, or mulching, and afterward, take a fun nature walk and explore the natural wonders of the park or search for the park’s many historic elements.

Pop-Up Lefferts Play and Go Kit features a fun assortment of historic games that include Quoits, Rolling Hoops, Game of Graces, Checkers, and Mancala. You can also take home some fun games such as Nine-Man Morris, Igba-Ita Game of Chance, Lenape Dice Game or a DIY Scented Sachet Kit.

Pop-Up Audubon Play and Go Kits feature a range of fun nature activities and games, as well as a birdwatching checklist with binoculars, and much more. Pop-Up Programs are made possible through the generous support of Con Edison.

Nature Helper’s: 2:00 p.m.

Help do your part to keep Prospect Park healthy by cleaning up the lakeshore. In this citizen science activity, Audubon staff will guide groups to remove litter and record their findings from around the park. Fun for all ages and all materials are provided. This program departs promptly at 2:00 p.m.

Family Discovery Walk: 3:00 p.m.

Prospect Park is a stopping point for hundreds of bird species each year! Join Prospect Park Alliance’s Audubon Center as we search for these amazing creatures and other nature around the park. Binoculars and bird guides are provided. This program departs promptly at 3:00 p.m.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Dog Beach (in Prospect Park)

title: Olmsted 200: Lungs of the City: Olmsted's Parks in Music
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

Join Prospect Park Alliance and the American Wild Ensemble for Lungs of the City: Olmsted’s Parks in Music is a program of new chamber music commemorating the 2022 bicentennial of the birth of Frederick Law Olmsted. In this concert, American Wild Ensemble, a septet of winds, strings, and percussion, will perform eight new works inspired by Olmsted-designed parks including Brooklyn’s Prospect Park and Manhattan’s Fort Tryon Park. The program includes newly commissioned works by composers Oliver Caplan, Nell Shaw Cohen, Michael-Thomas Foumai, Libby Meyer, Ayumi Okada, Justin Ralls, Christina Rusnak, and Ryan Suleiman. Lungs of the City: Olmsted’s Parks in Musicis a cross-regional concert series of world premieres co-curated and co-commissioned by American Wild Ensemble, Juventas New Music Ensemble, Landscape Music, and Michigan Technological University Department of Visual and Performing Arts.

Start time: 12:00 pm

title: Still Waters: Reflections of a Maritime Community
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

A permanent exhibition celebrating the community's maritime heritage.

Located on the southermost point of New York, Tottenville's coastal environment was at the center of its rich maritime history. The surrounding waterways provided economic and social benefits, and the area became a natural location for bustling shipbuilding and repair yards. The Rutan-Becket House stands as a testament to this industry. The exhibition highlights both the economic and social use of the waterfront from the mid-19th century through the 20th century with photographs, artifacts, and artwork.

The exhibition is open by appointment.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 552-7171

title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Start time: 1:00 pm

End time: 1:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 879-0794

title: Performance: Retumba
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

Retumba is a multi-ethnic, all-female Afro-Caribbean dance and percussion ensemble whose electrifying presentations have been heard throughout the United States for almost 30 years. Retumba interweaves the dynamic power of Caribbean polyrhythms with the drama and excitement of African dance. Dressed in festive, traditional garb, this seasoned ensemble celebrates traditional Caribbean culture through engaging, staged performances of folkloric music such as guaguancó from Cuba, bomba and plena from Puerto Rico, and merengue from Dominican Republic. Noteworthy past engagements include performances at Alice Tully Hall and The Music Center of Los Angeles and a special concert for the United Nations.

In partnership with the Center for Traditional Music and Dance

Start time: 1:00 pm

End time: 2:00 pm

Location: Haffen Park

title: Concert: Teddy Royal & Company
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

Guitar great Teddy Royal has worked with numerous notable musicians, including Hank Crawford, Allen Toussaint, Koko Taylor, Lou Rawls and Patti Labelle. But he is perhaps best known for his 30-year run as lead guitarist for New Orleans' legendary Fats Domino. Mr. Royal is also a composer and distinguished bandleader, with several albums to his own name. For this concert he brings a quartet that is sure to delight.

This project is supported in part by an award from the National Endowment for the Arts, the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of the Office of the Governor and the New York State Legislature and by public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council and by the Howard Gilman Foundation.

title: Movie Under the Stars: Shrek
description:
Date: May 28, 2022

Grab a blanket and come enjoy a movie in a neighborhood park or playground! This summer, NYC Parks and The Mayor’s Office of Media and Entertainment will host family-friendly movie showings across the five boroughs.

A green ogre living a life of solitude in a far away swamp, Shrek is suddenly invaded by a horde of fairy tale characters, such as the Big Bad Wolf and the Three Little Pigs, all refugees of their homes who have been shunned by the evil Lord Farquaad. Shrek decides to offer Lord Farquaad a deal; he will rescue the beautiful Princess Fiona , who is intended to be Farquaad's bride, in exchange for peace and quiet at his swamp.

Movies begin at dusk. This event is FREE and open to the public. Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited. In the event of heavy rain or extreme weather, the screening may be canceled. The decision to cancel the event will be made prior to the screening and will be prominently posted on our website.

For more information visit nyc.gov/parks or call 311. Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 8:00 pm

End time: 10:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Franklin D. Roosevelt Boardwalk and Beach (in Lemon Creek Park)
location: Franklin D. Roosevelt Boardwalk and Beach (in Lemon Creek Park)
categories: Free Summer Movies | Movies Under the Stars

description:

Animal Encounter, 11 am–12 pm: Join Alliance Naturalists in learning more about the animals in the Audubon Center’s collection. This program starts promptly at 11 am.
Nature’s Helpers, 12–1 pm: Help do your part to keep Prospect Park healthy by cleaning up the lakeshore. In this citizen science activity Audubon staff will guide groups to remove litter and record the findings. Fun for all ages and all materials are provided. This program departs from the Audubon Center promptly at 12 pm.

title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: May 29, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 11:45 am

title: Play + Go and Green + Grow in Prospect Park
description:
Date: May 29, 2022

Families and children can enjoy nature and explore the park on their own schedule with Play + Go and Green + Grow Pop-Up Programs! Join Prospect Park Alliance at locations around the park and surrounding neighborhoods as we bring our favorite activities from the Prospect Park Audubon Center and Lefferts Historic House on the road in easy-to-borrow play and go kits.

Come to the Pop-Up and hand pick your own Play + Go Kit with up to five (5) items and mix and match some historic games and toys or nature games and activities. Participate in our new Green + Grow activities by lending a hand in a stewardship activity such as raking, litter patrol, or mulching, and afterward, take a fun nature walk and explore the natural wonders of the park or search for the park’s many historic elements.

Pop-Up Lefferts Play and Go Kit features a fun assortment of historic games that include Quoits, Rolling Hoops, Game of Graces, Checkers, and Mancala. You can also take home some fun games such as Nine-Man Morris, Igba-Ita Game of Chance, Lenape Dice Game or a DIY Scented Sachet Kit.

Pop-Up Audubon Play and Go Kits feature a range of fun nature activities and games, as well as a birdwatching checklist with binoculars, and much more. Pop-Up Programs are made possible through the generous support of Con Edison.

Nature Helper’s: 2:00 p.m.

Help do your part to keep Prospect Park healthy by cleaning up the lakeshore. In this citizen science activity, Audubon staff will guide groups to remove litter and record their findings from around the park. Fun for all ages and all materials are provided. This program departs promptly at 2:00 p.m.

Family Discovery Walk: 3:00 p.m.

Prospect Park is a stopping point for hundreds of bird species each year! Join Prospect Park Alliance’s Audubon Center as we search for these amazing creatures and other nature around the park. Binoculars and bird guides are provided. This program departs promptly at 3:00 p.m.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Location: Dog Beach (in Prospect Park)

title: Geology: Inwood Rocks!
description:
Date: May 29, 2022

New York City is the site of ancient earth-shaking and earth-shaping events. The bedrock that anchors the city’s skyscrapers tells a story of a place going back more than a billion years. The island of Manhattan is built on three strata known as Manhattan Schist, Inwood Marble, and Fordham Gneiss.

title: HEART OF A HOUSE: The Olmsted-Beil House
description:
Date: May 30, 2022

Presented by Friends of Olmsted-Beil House, this exhibit will share the story of the c1685 Olmsted-Beil House and those who owned the home, including Dominie Petrus Tesschenmaker (1685-1696), Frederick Law Olmsted (1848-1855), Carlton and Louise Beil (1955-2006), and many other prominent and noteworthy individuals and families. The exhibit includes photographic images, paintings, wall text, video, books, artifacts, sculptures, and collections.

The Olmsted-Beil House on Staten Island is a New York City Landmark listed on the New York State and National Registers of Historic Places.

Opening reception: Sunday, May 29, 2022 from 1:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m.

Closed Sundays and holidays.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

title: Memorial Day in Prospect Park
description:
Date: May 30, 2022

Join Prospect Park Alliance on Memorial Day for family-friendly nature education programs at Prospect Park Audubon Center and the Prospect Park Carousel.

Nature Exploration
Prospect Park Audubon Center, 11–3 pm
Join Prospect Park Alliance for nature education programs at the Prospect Park Audubon Center, the first urban Audubon Center in the nation.

Discovery Pack, 11–3 pm: Come explore nature on your own with our Discovery Packs, a backpack filled with nature activities and exploration tools, perfect for families and kids to interact with the park in a whole new way!
Animal Encounter, 1- 2 pm: Join Alliance Naturalists in learning more about the animals in the Audubon Center’s collection. This program starts promptly at 2 pm.
Family Bird Walk, 2 – 3 pm: Prospect Park is a stopping point for hundreds of bird species each year! Join us as we search for these amazing creatures and other nature around the park. Binoculars and bird guides are provided. This program leaves the Audubon Center promptly at 3 pm.

Carousel Rides, 12–5 pm
Children’s Corner, $3 per ride, $13 for a book of 5 tickets, Free with Prospect Park Alliance Family Supporter membership or higher.

Celebrate Memorial Day with a ride on Prospect Park’s beloved 1912 Carousel

Join the Alliance at the Family Supporter level or above and enjoy unlimited free rides!

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Audubon Center at the Boathouse (in Prospect Park),Children's Corner (in Prospect Park)

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: May 31, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 7:30 am

End time: 8:30 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
categories: Nature | Fitness | Outdoor Fitness | Seniors | Hiking | Strength Training/Weightlifting | Walking

title: Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy
description:
Date: May 31, 2022

See Frederick Law Olmsted’s lasting influence on park innovation in New York City with “Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy,” on view at the Arsenal Gallery in Central Park. The commemorative exhibition looks at recent NYC Parks projects that incorporate various Olmsted design principles, including site responsiveness, respect for nature, and the orchestration of movement. With renderings, site plans, and photos, the show highlights 10 park renovations throughout the city:

  • Bronx: Hugh Grant Circle/Virginia Park and Concrete Plant Park
  • Brooklyn: Lincoln Terrace Playground and Sunset Park Playground
  • Manhattan: Monsignor Kett Playground and Central Park’s Harlem Meer Center (formerly Lasker Rink and Pool)
  • Queens: Elmhurst Park and Bayswater Park
  • Staten Island: Faber Park and Richmond Terrace

April 26, 2022 marks the 200th anniversary of the birth of Frederick Law Olmsted (1822-1903), a pioneer landscape architect famous for his work co-designing Central Park, Prospect Park, and other well-known urban green spaces. From the democratization of public parks to the contouring of landscape and terrain to create a variety of visual experience, Olmsted was a seminal force in the design of our parks and how they are used.

Image: Concrete Plant Park, Bronx, 2009, NYC Parks / Jim Mituzas

Please note: Mask-wearing is required to enter the Arsenal Gallery, and guests are required to sign in. Groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register. The gallery is closed on federal holidays.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: The Arsenal

title: HEART OF A HOUSE: The Olmsted-Beil House
description:
Date: May 31, 2022

Presented by Friends of Olmsted-Beil House, this exhibit will share the story of the c1685 Olmsted-Beil House and those who owned the home, including Dominie Petrus Tesschenmaker (1685-1696), Frederick Law Olmsted (1848-1855), Carlton and Louise Beil (1955-2006), and many other prominent and noteworthy individuals and families. The exhibit includes photographic images, paintings, wall text, video, books, artifacts, sculptures, and collections.

The Olmsted-Beil House on Staten Island is a New York City Landmark listed on the New York State and National Registers of Historic Places.

Opening reception: Sunday, May 29, 2022 from 1:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m.

Closed Sundays and holidays.

title: Movies Under the Stars: The Mitchells vs. The Machines
description:
Date: May 31, 2022

Grab a blanket and come enjoy a movie in a neighborhood park or playground! This spring, NYC Parks and The Mayor’s Office of Media and Entertainment will host family-friendly movie showings across the five boroughs.

"After Katie Mitchell is accepted to the university of her dreams, her father, Rick, decides that it will only be fitting for the whole family to drive her to school and have an adventure. However, their plans are ruined when technology—phones, appliances, and personal robots, among others—stages a revolution against humanity. They now find themselves with two malfunctioning robots working to save the world from destruction."

Movies begin at dusk. This event is FREE and open to the public. Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited. In the event of heavy rain or extreme weather, the screening may be canceled. The decision to cancel the event will be made prior to the screening and will be prominently posted on our website.

For more information visit nyc.gov/parks or call 311. Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

This movie is sponsored by Council Member Carlina Rivera.

Start time: 8:30 pm

End time: 10:30 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Athletic Field (in Peter's Field)
categories: Film | Free Summer Movies | Movies Under the Stars

title: Sunrise Tai Chi
description:
Date: June 1, 2022

Fort Tryon Park has long been a place of healing and health, especially during the stress of the pandemic. Take in the majestic views of the Hudson River while boosting your mental and physical health at weekly classes with instructor Robert Martinez.

Tai chi is a system of movements and positions believed to have developed in 12th Century China. Tai chi techniques aim to address the body and mind as interconnected systems. Benefits include improved balance, pain management, improved brain function and sleep quality, and communal activity.

These classes are suitable for all levels. Wear comfortable clothing and bring water.

Please check the Fort Tryon Park Trust’s Facebook Page for weather/air advisory cancellations.

Please arrive on time.

Start time: 6:30 am

End time: 7:30 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

title: Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy
description:
Date: June 1, 2022

See Frederick Law Olmsted’s lasting influence on park innovation in New York City with “Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy,” on view at the Arsenal Gallery in Central Park. The commemorative exhibition looks at recent NYC Parks projects that incorporate various Olmsted design principles, including site responsiveness, respect for nature, and the orchestration of movement. With renderings, site plans, and photos, the show highlights 10 park renovations throughout the city:

  • Bronx: Hugh Grant Circle/Virginia Park and Concrete Plant Park
  • Brooklyn: Lincoln Terrace Playground and Sunset Park Playground
  • Manhattan: Monsignor Kett Playground and Central Park’s Harlem Meer Center (formerly Lasker Rink and Pool)
  • Queens: Elmhurst Park and Bayswater Park
  • Staten Island: Faber Park and Richmond Terrace

April 26, 2022 marks the 200th anniversary of the birth of Frederick Law Olmsted (1822-1903), a pioneer landscape architect famous for his work co-designing Central Park, Prospect Park, and other well-known urban green spaces. From the democratization of public parks to the contouring of landscape and terrain to create a variety of visual experience, Olmsted was a seminal force in the design of our parks and how they are used.

Image: Concrete Plant Park, Bronx, 2009, NYC Parks / Jim Mituzas

Please note: Mask-wearing is required to enter the Arsenal Gallery, and guests are required to sign in. Groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register. The gallery is closed on federal holidays.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: The Arsenal

title: HEART OF A HOUSE: The Olmsted-Beil House
description:
Date: June 1, 2022

Presented by Friends of Olmsted-Beil House, this exhibit will share the story of the c1685 Olmsted-Beil House and those who owned the home, including Dominie Petrus Tesschenmaker (1685-1696), Frederick Law Olmsted (1848-1855), Carlton and Louise Beil (1955-2006), and many other prominent and noteworthy individuals and families. The exhibit includes photographic images, paintings, wall text, video, books, artifacts, sculptures, and collections.

The Olmsted-Beil House on Staten Island is a New York City Landmark listed on the New York State and National Registers of Historic Places.

Opening reception: Sunday, May 29, 2022 from 1:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m.

Closed Sundays and holidays.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

title: (Mandarin) Little Red's Hood at Leif Ericson Park
description:
Date: June 1, 2022

Little Red’s Hood is a fresh retelling of the classic ‘Little Red Riding Hood’ tale updated with a modern sensibility that appeals to kids. In this story, Little Red is a smart, young city dweller who is obsessed with her smartphone. Wulfric, a misunderstood wolf with a sweet tooth, crosses paths with Little Red on her travels to deliver her Grandma cupcakes and the trouble begins. This story offers a comical lesson on the importance to disconnect from our digital lives and enjoy real life moment with friends and family.

Argentine Tango is an interpretive, improvisational social dance that allows the dancers to develop a deep connection between themselves, the music, and the environment in which they are dancing.

title: The Astoria Park Carnival
description:
Date: June 1, 2022

Come one, come all! The Annual Astoria Park Carnival is back! Rides, games, and so much food it's fun for the whole family! Admission is free, but rides require tickets that you can purchase at the carnival.

Astoria Park Carnival Schedule
The carnival starts on Wednesday, June 1 and goes until Sunday, June 5. Hours vary by day:

  • Wednesday, June 1: 4:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m.
  • Thursday, June 2: 4:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m.
  • Friday, June 3: 4:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.
  • Saturday, June 4: Noon to midnight
  • Sunday, June 5: Noon to 11:00 p.m.

title: Harlem Swings and Hops!
description:
Date: June 1, 2022

Join us as we celebrate Harlem’s most famous dance genre with The Lindy Hop. We will start off with a mini dance lesson and continue with social dancing and hopping to some legendary Harlem jazz greats and more music from then up to now.

About The Harlem Swing Dance Society (THSDS):
The Harlem Swing Dance Society is a premier organization dedicated to culturally sharing the history is Lindy Hop, Swing dance, and the historic Savoy Ballroom in its Harlem home. Check their calendar and classes here: Theharlemswingdance.org

This event is FREE but RSVP is needed. To register go to swingpelham.eventbrite.com

• Wash your hands before attending a program.
• Stay home if you are sick.

For more information visit nyc.gov/parks or call 311. Contact accessibility@parks.nyc.gov or (212) 360-1430 for more information regarding accessibility. This event is sponsored by Council Member Kristin Richardson Jordan.

Start time: 5:00 pm

End time: 7:00 pm

title: Workshop for Volunteers: Budgeting for Success—Marketing & Fundraising Strategies
description:
Date: June 1, 2022

For community groups of any size, marketing and fundraising can be challenging. Join us as we welcome back our expert speakers from TD Bank, who will walk through the basics of marketing and fundraising for small nonprofits and community-based organizations dedicated to local parks. During this hour-long session, you’ll receive the tools and knowledge needed to build solid marketing and fundraising strategies that will help your group strengthen its accountability, identify potential new funders, and better plan for the future.

Join us to learn:

  • Accessible and inexpensive marketing strategies.
  • How to increase return on investment.
  • Other sources of support beyond PfP and TD Bank.

Guest speakers:

  • Amanda Foster, Vibrant Planet Relationship Manager, Office of Charitable and Community Giving
  • Marcus Gonzales, Vice President, Community Business Development Office
  • Anne LaFond, Art Director, Partnerships for Parks
  • Brittany Thomas, Senior Group Manager, Digital Marketing

Traducción en Español disponible. Registration for this session is required and will close the day before the event. You will receive information on how to join the webinar once you register.

At Partnerships for Parks, we help people, organizations, and government work together to support NYC parks, gardens, trees, and other green spaces. Our free workshops are a great way to network and learn the skills needed to start, build, or sustain your park group.

Start time: 6:00 pm

title: Sunset Yoga
description:
Date: June 1, 2022

Enjoy free yoga classes while overlooking the beautiful Hudson River and basking in the glow of the setting sun!

Bring a towel or a yoga mat and water. Use your masks and socially distance as appropriate.

Abby’s Lawn is slightly sloped and there are some uneven spots. Rain or wet ground cancels the class. For cancelations, check the Fort Tryon Park Facebook Page.

Please note: There is no advance registration. Arrive early as capacity is limited and attendance is on a first-come, first-served basis. Every attendee must sign an NYC Parks/Fort Tryon Park Trust waiver on-site at each session. You must sign in each week. Sign the waiver with our volunteer starting 6:30 p.m.

About the Instructor

Certified instructor, Stacey Linden, has been teaching yoga for twenty years and it has been integral in her life — physically, mentally, and spiritually. We are happy to have her share its many facets with our park community. Stacey teaches at all levels and believes yoga should be practiced, not “perfected.” Every time we step onto our mats, we can be just a little surprised by where our bodies, minds, and breath are at that moment.

Sunset Yoga is a program presented by the Fort Tryon Park Trust.

Start time: 6:45 pm

End time: 8:00 pm

Location: Abby's Lawn (in Fort Tryon Park)

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: June 2, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 7:30 am

End time: 8:30 am

Contact phone: 2127951388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
categories: Nature | Fitness | Seniors | Hiking | Exercise Classes | Strength Training/Weightlifting | Walking

title: Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy
description:
Date: June 2, 2022

See Frederick Law Olmsted’s lasting influence on park innovation in New York City with “Parks Now: Honoring the Olmsted Legacy,” on view at the Arsenal Gallery in Central Park. The commemorative exhibition looks at recent NYC Parks projects that incorporate various Olmsted design principles, including site responsiveness, respect for nature, and the orchestration of movement. With renderings, site plans, and photos, the show highlights 10 park renovations throughout the city:

  • Bronx: Hugh Grant Circle/Virginia Park and Concrete Plant Park
  • Brooklyn: Lincoln Terrace Playground and Sunset Park Playground
  • Manhattan: Monsignor Kett Playground and Central Park’s Harlem Meer Center (formerly Lasker Rink and Pool)
  • Queens: Elmhurst Park and Bayswater Park
  • Staten Island: Faber Park and Richmond Terrace

April 26, 2022 marks the 200th anniversary of the birth of Frederick Law Olmsted (1822-1903), a pioneer landscape architect famous for his work co-designing Central Park, Prospect Park, and other well-known urban green spaces. From the democratization of public parks to the contouring of landscape and terrain to create a variety of visual experience, Olmsted was a seminal force in the design of our parks and how they are used.

Image: Concrete Plant Park, Bronx, 2009, NYC Parks / Jim Mituzas

Please note: Mask-wearing is required to enter the Arsenal Gallery, and guests are required to sign in. Groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register. The gallery is closed on federal holidays.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: The Arsenal

title: HEART OF A HOUSE: The Olmsted-Beil House
description:
Date: June 2, 2022

Presented by Friends of Olmsted-Beil House, this exhibit will share the story of the c1685 Olmsted-Beil House and those who owned the home, including Dominie Petrus Tesschenmaker (1685-1696), Frederick Law Olmsted (1848-1855), Carlton and Louise Beil (1955-2006), and many other prominent and noteworthy individuals and families. The exhibit includes photographic images, paintings, wall text, video, books, artifacts, sculptures, and collections.

The Olmsted-Beil House on Staten Island is a New York City Landmark listed on the New York State and National Registers of Historic Places.

Opening reception: Sunday, May 29, 2022 from 1:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m.

Closed Sundays and holidays.

Start time: 10:00 am

In this story, Little Red is a smart, young city dweller who is obsessed with her smartphone. Wulfric, a misunderstood wolf with a sweet tooth, crosses paths with Little Red on her travels to deliver her Grandma cupcakes and the trouble begins. title: Weekday Nature Exploration
description:
Date: June 2, 2022

Join Prospect Park Alliance for nature education programs on Thursdays and Fridays at the Prospect Park Audubon Center, the first urban Audubon Center in the nation.

Discovery Pack, 12–3 pm: Come explore nature on your own with our Discovery Packs, a backpack filled with nature activities and exploration tools, perfect for families and kids to interact with the park in a whole new way!
Animal Encounter, 2–3 pm: Join Alliance Naturalists in learning more about the animals in the Audubon Center’s collection. This program starts promptly at 2 pm.
Family Bird Walk, 3–4 pm: Prospect Park is a stopping point for hundreds of bird species each year! Join us as we search for these amazing creatures and other nature around the park. Binoculars and bird guides are provided. This program departs from the Audubon Center promptly at 3 pm.

Start time: 12:00 pm

title: Gross Anatomy the Musical
description:
Date: June 2, 2022

Join Adrian Miranda at DFM for a performance of "Gross Anatomy."

Adrian Miranda is a Upper Manhattan-based television writer/actor of Gross Anatomy and a licensed doctor of physical therapy. Gross Anatomy is a sketch comedy show about anatomy that follows Dr. Dennis, a former doctor of physical therapy, turned teacher as he learns how to teach rowdy students of all ages about how their body works.

Please bring your own chairs or blankets to sit on in the farmhouse gardens.

title: Hudson Classical Theater Company Presents: Richard II
description:
Date: June 2, 2022

The Hudson Classical Theater Company presents a season of the classics in Riverside Park!

June 2 - 26, Thursday - Sunday evenings at 6:30pm: Shakespeare's Richard II

Richard II is a naive, ambitious, and reckless young king who believes he is anointed by God. By stealing his dead uncle's estate from his banished cousin, Bolingbroke, Richard II sets in motion his own downfall.

All audience members must show proof of being fully vaccinated and must wear a mask before, during, and after the show in the space. Check in starts 45 minutes before the show. Seating starts at approximately 6pm.

Start time: 6:30 pm

End time: 8:30 pm

title: South Rochdale Playground Virtual Community Input Meeting
description:
Date: June 2, 2022

Join a virtual discussion, share your thoughts, ideas, or concerns regarding the reconstruction of South Rochdale Playground. This online event can be accessed by computer, mobile device, or dial in from any phone.

All ages are welcomed, anyone under 18 years, must be accompanied by an adult. Registrants will receive the Zoom meeting link and phone number via email, the day of, one hour before start time. Please check your spam folder.

For more information, or accessibility or translation questions, email Lori Polizzi by May 26 at lori.polizzi@parks.nyc.gov.

title: STM Adult Lap Swim
description:
Date: June 3, 2022

Enjoy exclusive lap swim in the Early Bird hours from 7:00 - 8:30 a.m. and Night Owl hours from 7:00 - 8:30 p.m., Monday through Friday at select outdoor pools. Meet the challenge of swimming 25 miles or more over the summer months and earn a 25-miler t-shirt or test yourself by entering a top 3 swimmer competition at your pool and win a first, second or third place distance trophy. Those who complete 25 miles or place among the top 3 distance swimmers at their pool are invited to attend an end of season awards party that includes refreshments, live music, a synchronized swim exhibition and competitive relay races to celebrate health and fitness achievements.

description:

Your body hears everything, what are your abs saying to you? Class will start with the Pilates ring also known as the magic circle for an upper and lower ab burning workout. Scissor kicks, leg lifts, v-ups, bicycle crunches, jack knifes and more is the perfect blend of exercises to work the abs and obliques with focus on breathing too. title: HEART OF A HOUSE: The Olmsted-Beil House
description:
Date: June 3, 2022

Presented by Friends of Olmsted-Beil House, this exhibit will share the story of the c1685 Olmsted-Beil House and those who owned the home, including Dominie Petrus Tesschenmaker (1685-1696), Frederick Law Olmsted (1848-1855), Carlton and Louise Beil (1955-2006), and many other prominent and noteworthy individuals and families. The exhibit includes photographic images, paintings, wall text, video, books, artifacts, sculptures, and collections.

The Olmsted-Beil House on Staten Island is a New York City Landmark listed on the New York State and National Registers of Historic Places.

Opening reception: Sunday, May 29, 2022 from 1:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m.

Closed Sundays and holidays.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: June 3, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Start time: 11:00 am

title: A Life Lived - Oral Story Telling for Adults: Virtual and Live
description:
Date: June 3, 2022

Many older adults have lived a life they often do not share. In this class, participants will tell their stories to record for themselves or leave behind as a legacy for their families. They are the keepers of the family stories and have survived much like warriors. we will go through the developmental years from childhood into adulthood.

Childhood: What were you like as a child? (curious, rambunctious, creative, talkative, quiet, etc?) What caught your attention? What did you get into trouble for? (curiosity, creativity, being the oldest/youngest/middle child), Who were your role models? What did you do that was unusual? Did your childhood personality predict who you would be as an adult?

Stories may be submitted for publication. Writers and storytellers retain rights to their stories.

Please note: This class is open to adults via Zoom if unable to attend in person. To register for the Zoom link, please email Lucy.Aponte@parks.nyc.gov. In-person participation will take place at St. Mary's Recreation Center at 450 St. Ann's Avenue, Bron NY 10455.

title: Weekday Nature Exploration
description:
Date: June 3, 2022

Join Prospect Park Alliance for nature education programs on Thursdays and Fridays at the Prospect Park Audubon Center, the first urban Audubon Center in the nation.

Discovery Pack, 12–3 pm: Come explore nature on your own with our Discovery Packs, a backpack filled with nature activities and exploration tools, perfect for families and kids to interact with the park in a whole new way!
Animal Encounter, 2–3 pm: Join Alliance Naturalists in learning more about the animals in the Audubon Center’s collection. This program starts promptly at 2 pm.
Family Bird Walk, 3–4 pm: Prospect Park is a stopping point for hundreds of bird species each year! Join us as we search for these amazing creatures and other nature around the park. Binoculars and bird guides are provided. This program departs from the Audubon Center promptly at 3 pm.

Start time: 12:00 pm

title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: June 3, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Start time: 1:00 pm

End time: 1:45 am

title: Baby & Me Yoga in The Battery Labyrinth
description:
Date: June 3, 2022

The Battery Conservancy and HRP Mamas invite parents to practice yoga with their babies in a relaxed, supportive environment while learning to regain the strength in their core muscles after giving birth. Babies are placed on a yoga blanket in front of mom’s mat (or they can be kept in their stroller if they’re sleeping!).

This flowing yoga practice focuses on strengthening the Pelvic floor and abdominal muscles (you will be checked for Diastasis Recti.) Students are welcome to take a break to feed or change their baby if needed. Baby Yoga, massage, and songs are included.

Babies are 4-6 weeks until crawling.

Bring a yoga mat for you and a blanket or beach towel to place your baby on in front of your mat.

Learn more about programs, events, and how you can get involved at hrpmamas.com and thebattery.org.

Start time: 1:30 pm

End time: 3:30 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Labyrinth Farm (in The Battery)

title: Prenatal Yoga in The Battery Labyrinth
description:
Date: June 3, 2022

The Battery Conservancy in collaboration with HRP Mamas invites you to Prenatal Yoga Friday afternoons in the Labyrinth with Mary Barnes

A flowing yoga class that helps you gain strength and flexibility through all trimesters of pregnancy, while teaching you how to use yoga to aid you during childbirth. Includes pelvic floor strengthening and awareness.

Learn how to safely strengthen your abdominals to maintain postural integrity during pregnancy and recover your abs quickly after giving birth.

Bring a yoga mat.

Learn more about programs, events, and how you can get involved at hrpmamas.com and thebattery.org.

Start time: 3:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

  • Thursday, June 2: 4:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m.

title: Concert: George Braith
description:
Date: June 3, 2022

A true original, saxophonist George Braith has brightened jazz with his innovations--from his classic 1960s recordings for Blue Note and Prestige, to his 1970s presentations at the lower Manhattan club Musart, which he ran, to his own, original instrument the Braithophone, which fuses soprano and alto saxophones into one horn. He has worked with many of the greats (Sonny Rollins, John Coltrane, Dizzy Gillespie, Grant Green, Roy Haynes) and has even been commemorated in mosaic tile in the walls of the 2nd Ave subway.
Supported in part by an award from the National Endowment for the Arts; the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of the Office of the Governor and the New York State Legislature; by public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council; and by the Howard Gilman Foundation.

NYC Parks is excited to be a Festival of New York partner and we want you to join us!

Start time: 6:00 pm

title: BX Expressions Concert: Durieux
description:
Date: June 3, 2022

Durieux is a self-taught singer-songwriter from the Bronx, NY, who’s sound blends elements of Alternative Rock, Funk, and Soul. He's a storyteller and a performer that writes his music, from the heart, based on experiences in life that anyone can find relatable. Music that will have you in your feelings, but also make you want to groove and be on stage with him singing your heart out. Durieux has performed on stages all over NYC and beyond. In NY he has performed at notable venues such as Rockwood Music Hall, Arlene’s Grocery, Mercury Lounge, Pianos, Bowery Electric, Central Park, The Groove, The Bronx Museum of The Arts, and The Apollo where he earned 2nd place at Amateur Night. He has also had the opportunity to play in Chicago, Texas, Philadelphia, Los Angeles, and Oakland. Check out his most latest single "Rumor" on all streaming platforms and the new music video for "Feel" on Youtube.” With guest act Zeyi.

Start time: 6:00 pm

End time: 7:30 pm
